page.title: 05HARESHAW LYNN
page.content: Hareshaw Lynn is an attractive{valley near Bellingham. Visitors like to follow the Hareshaw Burn up to the { {waterfall}which is about ten metres high. The path winds its way along the { {stream}for one and a half miles across six bridges through three gates and past four resting benches.Many species of{flowers}and {wild life}can be seen during the four seasons. The Lynn(waterfall) is enclosed by trees and surrounded by a strong fence which keeps out straying animals. In the olden days people used to put their best clothes on and go to the Lynn to listen to a band which played in a clearing near the last bridge. Now it is sometimes used for nature trails whan people can follow a planned route leaning as they go. It is a pleasant walk all year round.
